poem:
The Debate and the Dawn

Morning tumbles through the window,
another second chance for his voice,
even as whispers swirl like autumn leaves
among the polished marble halls.
He clings to sunlight, brushes off the shadows,
the weight of years and words,
carrying the resilient hearts of voters,
like a raft
on shifting tides.
